The Cavaliers, on the other hand, are still leading the Eastern Conference since the start of the championship, and they're not planning on giving up that spot any time soon.
Cleveland is now 5.0 wins ahead of second Boston, and the Cavs themselves have only failed 4 games out of 33 this season.
Just ahead of the meeting with Dallas, Cleveland has a streak of eight straight wins.
The club from Ohio State has a tour of the West, already securing three victories.
Dallas also failed against Portland (122:126), Sacramento (100:110) and Houston (99:110).
